intro: Ruellia tolimensis, commonly known as the Tolima ruellia, is a flowering plant native to Colombia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its attractive blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Ruellia tolimensis is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
